connectMB.connectCable.downloadProject.s.value: Connect a micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable to download your machine learning MakeCode program to it.

connectMB.connectCable.subtitle.value: Connect the micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable so that the data collection program can be downloaded to it.

connectMB.connectCableMB1.subtitle.value: Connect the first micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable so that the data collection program can be downloaded to it. This is the micro:bit you will use to collect data samples.

connectMB.connectCableMB2.subtitle.value: Connect a second micro:bit to this computer with a USB cable so that the radio link program can be downloaded to it. This radio link micro:bit will communicate with the data collection micro:bit.

connectMB.pattern.subtitle.value: Copy the pattern displayed on the micro:bit.

connectMB.transferHex.manualDownload.value: If the file did not automatically download then

content.data.addActionWalkThrough.value: Name an action you want the micro:bit to recognise

content.data.addRecordingWalkThrough.value: Press to record a data sample or press button B on your data collection micro:bit.

content.data.classHelpBody.value: The type of movement you want

content.data.dataDescription.value: Short collections of movement data lasting approximately 2 seconds. Your data samples are only stored on your computer, they do not get sent to anyone else.

content.index.dataWarning.subtitleOne.value: You have existing data samples and code that will be lost when you start a new session.

content.index.dataWarning.subtitleTwo.value: containing your data samples and code before continuing.

content.index.dataWarning.title.value: Existing data samples and code will be lost

content.model.output.action.descriptionB.value: The type of movement you want

content.model.output.certainty.descripti.value: How confident the model is that you are currently doing each action.

content.model.output.estimatedGesture.de.value: This is the action the model thinks you are currently doing.

content.model.output.output.descriptionB.value: These MakeCode blocks will show icons for each action detected when you transfer your code and model to a micro:bit.

content.trainer.description.value: The computer program spots patterns or differences in your data samples, and uses these to build a mathematical model that allows
to recognise different actions when you move your micro:bit.

content.trainer.failure.body.value: The training did not result in a usable model. The reason for this is most likely the data used for training. If the data samples for different actions are too similar, this can result in issues in the training process.

content.trainer.failure.todo.value: Return to the Add data page and change your data.

data-collection-microbit-label.value: diagram showing data collection micro:bit being connected to a person's wrist

disconnectedWarning.bluetooth1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit has been lost.

disconnectedWarning.bluetooth3.value: is powered on (the red light on the back of the micro:bit should be on)

disconnectedWarning.bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer has been lost.

disconnectedWarning.remote1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit has been lost.

download-project-choose-microbit-subtitl.value: Downloading your project on to the same micro:bit will disconnect the micro:bit from the tool. You will need to reconnect the micro:bit if you want to record more data samples.

download-project-choose-microbit-title.value: Which micro:bit do you want to use?

download-project-intro-description.value: Your program includes the machine learning model you created. The model runs on the micro:bit so you can use it without being connected to

download-project-intro-title.value: Download your machine learning MakeCode project

footer.helpContent.value: This graph shows movement data from the micro:bit's accelerometer in real time. Try moving your data collection micro:bit to see the X, Y and Z axes change. Each coloured line represents a different direction (dimension) you are moving the micro:bit in.

homepage-alt.value: graph showing x, y, z graph lines representing micro:bit accelerometer data

homepage-description.value: Train a machine learning model on your own movement data and run it on your micro:bit.

homepage-subtitle.value: Create AI on your BBC micro:bit using movement and machine learning.

homepage-video-prompt.value: Watch the video to learn how to use

insufficient-data-body.value: You need at least 3 data samples for 2 actions to train the model.

menu.trainer.notConnected1.value: You do not have a micro:bit connected

menu.trainer.notConnected2.value: Select the ‘Connect’ button to connect a micro:bit.

name-used-when.value: The name is used when you save a file.

newpage-continue-session-instruction.value: To continue a saved session from a file please select a file.

newpage-continue-session-subtitle.value: Use a hex file or data samples file you saved to your computer to continue a session.

newpage-heading-subtitle.value: Run whole class sessions, easily share code with students and save progress

newpage-new-session-subtitle.value: Connect your micro:bit and collect movement data to build a machine learning model.

newpage-section-one-title.value: Pick up where you left off

newpage-subtitle.value: Introduce students to machine learning concepts through physical movement and data

popup.compatibility.advice.value: We recommend Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge so you can connect directly to your micro:bit.

popup.compatibility.explain.value: Unfortunately, WebUSB and Web Bluetooth are not supported by this browser. This means you cannot connect to a micro:bit to record the data samples needed to train a machine learning model.

project-name-not-empty.value: The project name cannot be empty

radio-link-microbit-label.value: diagram showing radio link micro:bit being connected with a computer

reconnectFailed.bluetooth1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnectFailed.bluetoothHeading.value: Failed to reconnect to data collection micro:bit

reconnectFailed.bridge1.value: The connection to the micro:bit connected to your computer could not be re-established.

reconnectFailed.bridgeHeading.value: Failed to reconnect to radio link micro:bit

reconnectFailed.remote1.value: The connection to the data collection micro:bit could not be re-established.

reconnectFailed.remoteHeading.value: Failed to reconnect to data collection micro:bit

reconnectFailed.subtitle.value: Follow these instructions to restart the connection process.

recording-graph-label.value: graph showing micro:bit x, y, z accelerometer data for one recording

save-hex-dialog-heading.value: Save project as a hex file

save-hex-dialog-message1.value: The download contains your actions, data samples and your MakeCode project. Open it in

save-hex-dialog-message2.value: You can also open it with Microsoft MakeCode if you don't need to change the actions and data samples.

saving-description.value: Your download will be ready soon.

saving-toast-title.value: Your hex file has been downloaded

steps-alt.value: diagram showing the iterative process of collecting data, training a model, testing the model, and improving the model by improving the data collected before finally coding using the model.

test-model-intro-description.value: Find out if it correctly recognises each action. Add more data to improve the model.

tour-collectData-addActions-content.value: Decide what your other actions will be and what you will name them. You need at least 2 actions with 3 data samples to train the model. Your data samples are only stored on your computer, they do not get sent to anyone else.

tour-collectData-afterFirst-content.value: To train the machine learning model you need at least 3 data samples for 2 different actions.

tour-collectData-collectMore-content.value: Record more samples for this action. Collecting more samples should result in a better machine learning model.

tour-collectData-trainModel-content.value: When you have collected enough data samples you can train the machine learning model. You can come back later to remove or add more data and re-train to make the model more reliable.

tour-dataSamples-actions-content.value: An action is the type of movement you want the machine learning tool to recognise e.g. ‘waving’ or ‘clapping’. Decide what your first action will be, name it and then start recording data samples.

tour-dataSamples-connected-content.value: Now you can start collecting data samples to train a machine learning (ML) model to recognise different movements, or actions.

tour-dataSamples-connected-title.value: Your data collection micro:bit is connected!

tour-dataSamples-liveGraph-content.value: The graph shows movement data from the micro:bit’s accelerometer. Move your data collection micro:bit and see how the graph changes.

tour-testModel-afterTrain-content.value: Now test your machine learning model. Try each action by moving your data collection micro:bit. Does the model correctly estimate each action?

tour-testModel-certaintyRecognition-cont.value: The bar graph shows how confident the model is that you are doing each action. Move the slider to adjust the recognition point, or threshold.

tour-testModel-editInMakeCode-content.value: Open your project in MakeCode to download the program and your machine learning model to a micro:bit. You can add more blocks to create your own programs using your model.

tour-testModel-estimatedAction-content.value: The action the model estimates you are currently doing is shown below the micro:bit icon for that action.

tour-testModel-makeCodeBlocks-content.value: These MakeCode blocks will show icons for each action detected when you transfer your code and model to a micro:bit.

train-model-intro-description.value: Ask the computer to use your training samples to train the machine learning model to recognise different actions.

unplug-radio-link-microbit-description.value: Unplug the radio link micro:bit from the computer. You will need to reconnect the micro:bit if you want to record more data samples.

unplug-radio-link-microbit-label.value: animation showing a USB cable being disconnected from the top of a micro:bit
